intro: Anthobolus triqueter, commonly known as the three-angled sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine, hairy foliage. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. Anthobolus triqueter thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
